alert.note: Alert for Angelina; Nacogdoches; San Augustine (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 23 at 8:18PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN NACOGDOCHES... ANGELINA AND CENTRAL SAN AUGUSTINE COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM CST... At 816 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hudson to near Diboll to 6 miles southeast of Corrigan. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lufkin, Diboll, Hudson, Huntington, Melrose, Woden, Macune, Etoile, Burke, Zavalla, Chireno, Broaddus, Denning, Shawnee, Homer, and Dolan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Lake Sam Rayburn, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
